text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The police claim that a number of stolen cars ....... recovered?
explanation:
When the phrase 'a number of' is used in a sentence, it is followed by a plural verb, hence 'have been' is the correct answer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

....... been there to look several times without success?
explanation:
The contracted word with a subject is 'He has'. Has is usually not contracted except it comes before 'been'
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The old man was rushed to hospital when his blood pressure dropped to a ....... level?
explanation:
It is grammatically correct to say 'a dangerously low level'
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Until he lost the election, agbo ....... to be Student Union president?
explanation:
The past perfect tense 'had been hoping' complete the sentences appropriately.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

If he ....... for admission, I am sure he would succeed?
explanation:
Would is the past tense of 'will', therefore 'applied' is the correct answer as it is in its past tense.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The ....... robber showed no mercy during the attack?
explanation:
Ruthless means being cruel and heartless.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Did you have ....... when you went to visit the medical doctor?
explanation:
Diarrhoea is a condition in which faeces are discharged from the bowels frequently and in a liquid form.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

your performance will improve if you ..... hard?
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The brave hunter killed the ...... in the forest?
explanation:
The option provides size, colour and purpose as the adjectives, and cobra as the noun. According to the order of adjectives, big, black, spitting cobra is the correct answer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

He wrote to you, .......?
explanation:
''didn't he' is the appropriate question tag because the statement contains a lexical verb 'wrote' and there is an absence of 'not' in the statement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The clubs were not ...... on a solid ethical base?
explanation:
The sentence requires a past tense to fill the gap because 'were' is the past tense of 'was'.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

I watched him as he ....... the hole?
explanation:
Dug is the past tense of dig.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

His father hardly misses the news because he goes about with his ....... radio?
explanation:
Portable is the correct spelling. This means being able to be easily carried or moved, especially because it is of a lighter and smaller version than usual.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The investigation Commission has treated all the ......submitted to it by the warning factions?
explanation:
A petition is a request to do something, most commonly addressed to a government official or public entity.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Olu brought his clothes and those of his ...... ?
explanation:
'Those of his' already indicate possession. Therefore 'those of his elder brothers' imply 'the clothes of his elder brothers''.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Our neighbour was attracted by the ....... from my mother's cooking?
explanation:
Aroma is most appropriate because it is a distinctive, usually pleasant smell, esp of spices, cooking, wines, and plants.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Everybody is allowed to ....... his view on state matters?
explanation:
To air your opinion is to make your idea, opinion or argument known.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best best completes the gap(s).

Despite all preparations, the wedding did not ...... ?
explanation:
Come off means to happened as planned or to succeed
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

For beating...... his coursemate, Agbo was ..... from the university?
explanation:
Beat up means assault while rusticated is to spend a student from a university as a punishment.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

We have been living peacefully here but ....... hear rumours of war?
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

genealogy?
explanation:
click here

text:
Choose the appropriate stress pattern from the option. The syllables are written in capital letters.

catholicism?
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Choose the option that has a different stress pattern from the others.
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Choose the option that has a different stress pattern from the others.
explanation:
Competent - /ˈkɒm.pɪ.tənt/
Represent -  /ˌrep.rɪˈzent/
Syllables - /ˈsɪl.ə.bəlz/
Quality - /ˈkwɒl.ə.ti/
In English, stress is usually placed on the first syllable for nouns and adjectives, while it is placed on the last syllable for verbs. However, if there is a weak vowel in the syllable, the stress moves to the next syllable.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that has the same stress as the given word.

apparent
explanation:
Apparent: /əˈpær.ənt/
Arrested: /əˈres.tɪd/Telephone: /ˈtel.ɪˌfəʊn/Paragraph: /ˈpær.əˌɡræf/Appetite: /ˈæp.əˌtaɪt/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that has the same stress as the given word.

dovetail
explanation:
Dovetail/ˈdʌv.teɪl/ (first syllable stressed)
Stress Patterns of the Options:
A. proviso/prəˈvaɪ.zəʊ/ (second syllable stressed)B. simplicity/sɪmˈplɪ.sɪ.ti/ (second syllable stressed)C. jargon/ˈdʒɑː.ɡən/ (first syllable stressed)D. psychiatry/saɪˈkaɪ.ə.tri/ (second syllable stressed)
Since"jargon"has the samefirst-syllable stressas "dovetail," the correct answer isC. jargon.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Choose the option that has the same stress on the first syllable.
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Choose the option that has the same stress on the first syllable.
explanation:
Options A, B, and D are stressed on the second syllable except for option C which has its stress on the first syllable
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
In our college, the regulations concerning resits are grey area?

options.A: The regulation have just been revised
options.B: The regulations have been often ignored
options.D: The regulations are not very clear

explanation:
grey area. A concept or topic that is not clearly defined or that exists somewhere between two extreme positions. Indeterminate territory, undefined position, neither here nor there. For example, There's a largegray areabetween what is legal and what is not. This term, which usesgrayin the sense of “neither black nor white” (
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

Ogiri takes after his father, he fawns upon anyone with influence.

options.A: Like his father, Ogiri likes to flatter people with influence in society
options.B: Like his father, Ogiri hates influential people
options.C: Ogiri, who always follows his father, tries to act an influential man
options.D: Ogiri, who looks like his father, follows rich and influential people about

explanation:
Fawn is giving someone a lot of attention and praise in order to get that person's approval. Flatter means lavish praise and compliments on (someone), often insincerely and aiming to further one's own interests.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
You are to write a report and give it to the security office?

options.A: After writing your report, give it to the security office
options.B: You are writing a report, as the security office directed
options.C: The report you are writing should be given to the security office
options.D: You have been ordered to write a report, which you will give to the security office

explanation:
You have been ordered to carry out an action.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
After the war, the victors became increasingly vindictive?

options.A: Vengeful attacks were incessantly carried out on those who lost war
options.B: Friendly measures were taken to heal the wounds
options.C: Repressive measures were taken against those who lost the war
options.D: Those who won the war became treacherous

explanation:
Vindictive is having or showing a strong or unreasoning desire for revenge. This implies that there was a repression of the defeated after the war.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The prefect reeled off the names of all the students who broke the library?

options.A: The prefect gave a disjointed list of the students in the law library
options.B: The prefect omitted the names of the students who broke into the law library
options.C: The prefect submitted a complete list of the students who stole library books
options.D: The prefect gave an accurate list of the students who disobeyed library regulations

explanation:
The prefect was able to list all the names of the students who were responsible for breaking or damaging the library.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

I owe you far less than you owe me?

options.A: My debt to you is greater than yours to me
options.B: Your debt is not much greater than mine
options.C: What we owe each other is approximately the same
options.D: I owe you something, but you owe me much more

explanation:
This statement suggests that the speaker feels that the other owes much more than he/she owes the recipient.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
The dispute over land acquisition has come to a head?

options.A: The problem has reached crisis proportions
options.B: The problem has been referred to the headquarters
options.C: Because of the dispute, land acquisition has now been halted
options.D: The problem has now been solved

explanation:
Come to a head means reaching a crisis.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
He had hardly spoken when the bell rang?

options.A: He found it difficult to speak, and then the bell rang
options.B: When the bell rang, he was still speaking
options.C: The bell rang very soon after he spoke
options.D: He spoke in a harsh manner and the bell rang

explanation:
This implies that someone began to speak, but their speaking was interrupted by the sound of a bell ringing.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
I think she takes her guardian's support for granted?

options.A: Her guardian has been helping her for a long time, and she is very grateful to him
options.B: She wants her guardian to grant her more support
options.C: She thinks her guardian will no longer support her as he has been doing
options.D: Her guardian has been helping her for a long time, but she does not show enough gratitude

explanation:
She does not show enough gratitude.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
The class has fallen in with the teacher's plans?

options.A: The class has ignored the plans
options.B: The class has rejected the plans
options.C: The class has accepted the plans
options.D: The class has modified the plans

explanation:
Fallen in means to associate or begin to associate with.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The move to expel the chairman was sanctioned by members of the party?
explanation:
Sanctioned: give official permission or approval for (an action).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

Because Jamiu is so easily offended, he was not considered for the post of head boy?
explanation:
Easily offended: bad-tempered.
having or showing a tendency to be easily annoyed
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The witness provided a monstrous account of the event?
explanation:
Monstrous means having the ugly or frightening appearance of a monster. This could also inhumanly or outrageously evil or wrong.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

Adamu is rather meddlesome in dealing with his friends.
explanation:
Meddlesome: fond of meddling; interfering.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The commander said that the battle would be sustained, total and relentless?
explanation:
Relentless: unceasingly intense. Persistence
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The government has announced its preparedness for the scheme?
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The chairman advised the participants to follow convention in stating their points?
explanation:
Convention is a way in which something is usually done.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

His discovery of the vaccine became a quantum leap in search for a scientific cure for the illness.
explanation:
Quantum Leap: a huge, often sudden, increase or advance in something.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

After the meeting, I read a leer on his face as he looked at the woman?
explanation:
Leer: look or gaze in a lascivious or unpleasant way.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

His loss suddenly became redeemable?
explanation:
Redeemable is able to be recovered or saved from faults or bad aspects.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The plan has gone awry?
explanation:
Awry: away from the usual or expected course; amiss
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The judge emphasized his morbid desires in his judgement?
explanation:
Morbid: characterized by an unusual interest in disturbing and unpleasant subjects, especially death and disease.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The recommended novel has a convoluted theme?
explanation:
Convoluted is extremely complex and difficult to follow.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

The party men revelled all night when the election results were announced.
explanation:
Revel means to enjoy oneself in a lively and noisy way, especially with drinking and dancing.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.

He is a prolific writer?
explanation:
Prolific producing many works.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

hurt /həːt/

says; /sez/
wet; /wet/

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The usually hostile crowd was captivated by the player's winsome attitude?
explanation:
winsome: attractive or appealing in a fresh, innocent way.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

To encourage productivity we must reward industry and ______ laziness
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The reporter made a masterly analysis of the situation?
explanation:
Masterly: showing great skill; very accomplished.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

He has no reason to have his heart in his mouth?
explanation:
have his heart in his mouth: be very alarmed or apprehensive
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

That little boy has become quite chubby?
explanation:
Chubby: plump and rounded.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

He gave himself up by his plebeian tastes?
explanation:
plebeian: lacking in refinement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Akpan was able to douse the flames with the new piece of equipment?
explanation:
douse: extinguish (fire or light).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

No sooner had he arrived than it started to rain?
explanation:
No sooner is used to show that one thing happens immediately after another thing.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The action was premeditated?
explanation:
premeditated: (of an action, especially a crime) thought out or planned beforehand.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

A tentative solution was provided?
explanation:
tentative: not certain or fixed; provisional.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The chief said he would use the power inherent in his office to stop the celebration.
explanation:
Inherent: existing in something as a permanent, essential, or characteristic attribute.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

In our last play, Segun acted the hero?
explanation:
hero: the chief male character in a book, play, or film, who is typically identified with good qualities, and with whom the reader is expected to sympathize.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The point you have made is quite apt
explanation:
apt: appropriate or suitable in the circumstances.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The police found conclusive proof of the boy's guilt?
explanation:
conclusive: (of evidence or argument) having or likely to have the effect of proving a case; decisive.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The man drew a sword as people congregated round him?
explanation:
Congregated round: to come together in a large group of people or animals.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The notice reads, 'No cash translations in this hall'?
explanation:
Cash: money in coins or notes, as distinct from cheques, money orders, or credit.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
